skillTree.localised_description: Perhaps it is the Fly Lord's apparent nonchalance that enrages Tzeentch so? Whatever the reason, the Great Game's greatest player, and his greatest servant, have an adversary on which to focus their ire.

skillTree.localised_description: Kairos' scribes faithfully record every baleful whisper that passes his lips, that they be made real, in the form of the Daemonic Horrors that do his bidding.

skillTree.localised_description: Of all the gifts bestowed by the Dark Powers upon their followers, the boons of Tzeentch are surely the most desirable.

skillTree.localised_description: Every possible future blazes with the light of sorcery and change.

effects.description: Unlocks the Fragments of Sorcery slot for the first group of common spells
Unlocks the Fragments of Sorcery slot for the second group of common spells

skillTree.localised_description: To see the future is to know which tools can most efficiently enforce the fickle whims of Tzeentch.

effects.description: Unlocks the Fragments of Sorcery slot for the first group of uncommon spells

skillTree.localised_description: To know the future is to understand the true futility in mortal flailings against fate.

effects.description: Unlocks the Fragments of Sorcery slot for the second group of uncommon spells

skillTree.localised_description: "I could tell you of your defeat this day, but your future has already arrived. So let us meet it together, you and I."

effects.description: Unlocks the Fragments of Sorcery slot for the first group of rare spells

skillTree.localised_description: Infinite pasts lead to this point, where the foe is destroyed utterly in service of futures pleasing Tzeentch numbering nine times nine.

skillTree.localised_description: Though blind to the present, Kairos can look into the future and begin weaving spells far in advance, layering multitudinous slivers of power for just the right moment.

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

skillTree.localised_description: Though they may appear ridiculous, the whirling, screeching footsoldiers of the Great Conspirator are the iron in his feathered martial glove.

skillTree.localised_description: The many faces of the Wind-lord are described here, along with all the terrible mysteries of destiny. Between these lines lurks insanity, ever waiting to trap the unwary.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

Daemonic units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is low.
	
	Daemonic units also have:
	Physical Resistance
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

factionEffects.localised_description: Kairos sits at Tzeentch's right hand, stirring the stygian depths of the Well as he whispers aloud the secrets that only he can see.
